summary.para: Minimum delay that occurs between the time a sample is read from a source buffer and the time it reaches the speakers.

listheader.description: The delay reported is a variable value equal to the rough distance between the last sample submitted to the driver by XAudio2 and the sample currently playing. The following factors can affect the delay: playing multichannel audio on a hardware-accelerated device; the type of audio device (WavePci, WaveCyclic, or WaveRT); and, to a lesser extent, audio hardware implementation.

The delay reported is a fixed value, which is normally 1,024 samples (21.333 ms at 48 kHz). If XOverrideSpeakerConfig has been called using the XAUDIOSPEAKERCONFIG_LOW_LATENCY flag, the delay reported is 512 samples (10.667 ms at 48 kHz).
